required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Vascular Effects of a Single Bout of Electronic Cigarette Use
clinical_study.official_title: Vascular Effects of a Single Bout of Electronic Cigarette Use

brief_summary.textblock: Investigating the acute effects of a single use E-Cigarette upon vascular health.

detailed_description.textblock: Subjects will inhale e-cigarettes of 5.4%, 0%, and sham menthol inhaler to determine the effects upon to measures of vascular health. These measures will include Cardio-Ankle Vascular Index and Flow Mediated Dilation.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Subjects will be asked to inhale one of three mediums; 5.4% NBV e-ciggarette, 0% NBV cigarette, and sham menthol inhaler (no vapor). Baseline measurements will be conducted upon arrival and followed immediately post inhalation, 1-hour post, and finally 2-hours post. All trials will require a minimum of 48 hours washout.
study_design_info.masking_description: E-cigarettes being utilized are of the same brand and design. Additionally, the device will be covered by a sheath to ensure labeling is not visible to the subject.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in arterial stiffness and endothelial function with e-cigarette use.
primary_outcome.description: Arterial stiffness and endothelial function are two of the subclinical markers of vascular dysfunction

arm_group.description: Subjects will be asked to inhale an E-Cigarette with 5.4% NBV for 6 min.
Subjects will be asked to inhale an E-Cigarette with 0% NBV for 6 min.
Subjects will be asked to inhale a sham methole inhaler (that looks identical in looks to E-cigarette) for 6 minutes. This arm is to control for a potential effect of menthole.

intervention.description: E-Cigarette containing 5.4% nicotine will be administered to determine the effects on vascular function.
E-Cigarette containing 0% nicotine will be administered to determine the effects on vascular function.
Menthol inhaler will be administered to determine the effects on vascular function.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Apparently healthy, with no cardiovascular or metabolic diseases. Additionally, is not a frequent smoker of any kind.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cardiovascular or Metabolic Diseases and/or regular smoker.

facility.name: Cardiovascular Aging Research Lab at UT Austin
